Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns the attribute name as a String.

Returns: true if this attribute name is equal to the specified attribute object
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Compares this attribute name to another for equality.

Throws: if the attribute name was invalid
if the attribute name was null
Attributes.Name(java.lang.String).Description: Constructs a new attribute name using the given string name.

Returns: a hash code value for this object.
hashCode().Description: Computes the hash value for this attribute name.

ClassDesc: The Attributes.Name class represents an attribute name stored in this Map. Valid attribute names are case-insensitive, are restricted to the ASCII characters in the set [0-9a-zA-Z_-], and cannot exceed 70 characters in length. Attribute values can contain any characters and will be UTF8-encoded when written to the output stream. See the
